Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Interface IGameBoard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
    public interface IGameBoard
    A gameboard for a game of ConnectX, similar to Connect4 but with a larger size and varying amount-in-a-row required to win. Locations start at (row=0, col=0). which is the bottom left cell of the board. Initialization ensures: the board contains only empty characters and has NUM_ROWS rows, along with NUM_COLUMNS columns Defines: NUM_ROWS: the number of rows that the board has NUM_COLUMNS: the number of columns that the board has NUM_TO_WIN: the number of tokens in a row needed to 'win' Constraints: 0 < NUM_ROWS 0 < NUM_COLUMNS 0 < NUM_TO_WIN [A column in the board never has empty tokens "below" an X or O token, meaning that tokens are always dropped as low as possible in a column]

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Checks to see if there is a win (NUM_TO_WIN of the same token in a row) diagonally in both diagonal directions.
      default boolean checkForWin​(int c)
      Checks to see if the last token that was placed in the column passed into the function is a win (`numToWin()` of the same token in a row).
      default boolean checkHorizWin​(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Checks to see if the last token placed results in a win (NUM_IN_A_ROW of the same token in a row) horizontally.
      default boolean checkIfFree​(int c)
      Checks to see if the column is free to take another token or if the column is full.
      default boolean checkTie()
      Checks to see if there is a tie by checking if the board is completely full of tokens.
      default boolean checkVertWin​(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Checks to see if there is a win (NUM_TO_WIN of the same token in a row) in the column of the last token that was placed.
      void dropToken​(char p, int c)
      Takes the token that is being placed and drops it into the specified column.

        Gets the number of rows that a game board has
        Returns:

        Gets the number of columns that a game board has
        Returns:

      • getNumToWin

        int getNumToWin()
        Gets the number of tokens in a row that constitutes a win
        Returns:
        The number of tokens in a row required to win

      • whatsAtPos

        char whatsAtPos​(BoardPosition pos)
        Returns the token at a given position on the board, if one exists.
        Parameters:
        pos - the BoardPosition that is being checked
        Returns:
        return the token (any player character) that is at the position specified, or a space ' ' if no token has been placed at that position

      • dropToken

        void dropToken​(char p,
               int c)
        Takes the token that is being placed and drops it into the specified column.
        Parameters:
        p - the token that is being placed
        c - the column that this function is checking

      • checkForWin

        default boolean checkForWin​(int c)
        Checks to see if the last token that was placed in the column passed into the function is a win (`numToWin()` of the same token in a row). Does not check the entire board.
        Parameters:
        c - the column that this function is checking
        Returns:
        true if the last token placed results in a win and false if it does not.

      • checkHorizWin

        default boolean checkHorizWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char p)
        Checks to see if the last token placed results in a win (NUM_IN_A_ROW of the same token in a row) horizontally.
        Parameters:
        pos - the place that the last token was placed
        p - the player who placed the last piece
        Returns:
        true if the token placed by p at pos caused a horizontal NUM_IN_A_ROW-in-a-row

      • checkVertWin

        default boolean checkVertWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        Checks to see if there is a win (NUM_TO_WIN of the same token in a row) in the column of the last token that was placed.
        Parameters:
        pos - the place that the last token was placed
        p - the player that played the last piece
        Returns:
        true if the token placed by p at pos caused a vertical NUM_TO_WIN-in-a-row

      • checkDiagWin

        default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        Checks to see if there is a win (NUM_TO_WIN of the same token in a row) diagonally in both diagonal directions.
        Parameters:
        pos - the place that the last token was placed
        p - the player that played the last piece
        Returns:
        true if the token placed by p at pos caused a diagonal NUM_TO_WIN-in-a-row

      • checkIfFree

        default boolean checkIfFree​(int c)
        Checks to see if the column is free to take another token or if the column is full.
        Parameters:
        c - the column that this function is checking
        Returns:
        true if the column has room for another token and false if the column is full

      • isPlayerAtPos

        default boolean isPlayerAtPos​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char player)
        Checks to see if the token at board position `pos` is a token by `player`.
        Parameters:
        pos - the BoardPosition being checked
        player - the token that is being compared to the token at BoardPosition pos
        Returns:
        true if the player = the token at pos and false if player â‰  the token at pos

      • checkTie

        default boolean checkTie()
        Checks to see if there is a tie by checking if the board is completely full of tokens.
        Returns:
        true if the top row is completely full and false if the top row is not full.
